            About
            I am an analyst working in the genomics/genetic epidemiology field, primarily investigating interactions between genetic variants and environmental exposures. I use R for almost everything - reproducible research, workflow management, presentations. My github is a disorganized mess.
            
            
            Education
            University of Southern California | Los Angeles, CA
            MPH, Ph.D. Molecular Epidemiology
            University of California, Berkeley | Berkeley, CA
            B.A. Molecular and Cell Biology
            
            
            Interests
            Music I enjoy playing piano and bass, wanna jam sometime
            Spending time outdoors
            Reading

articles.title: Linear Algebra ASAP
articles.description: Working through linear algebra course online, notes for myself.
articles.contents:
Contents
Intro

Intro
Learning math requires a lot of study and practice. Let’s ignore all that and try to go over a typical college linear algebra course material in as few words as possible.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Publications


p {
  font-family: Roboto;
  text-align: justify;
}
Publications
Kim A.E., Drew D.A., et al (2021). “NSAIDs and colorectal cancer: results from a genome-wide interaction scan. [Unpublished Manuscript]
Diez-Obrero V., van Duijnhoven F.J.B., Kim A.E., et al (2021). “Calcium intake and risk of colorectal cancer: a genome-wide interaction study”. [Unpublished Manuscript]
Dimou N., Kim A.E., et al (2021). “Probing the diabetes and colorectal cancer relationship using gene-environment interaction analyses”. [Unpublished Manuscript]
Carreras-Torres, R., Kim A.E., et al (2021). “Genome-wide interaction study with tobacco smoking habits for risk of colorectal cancer identifies novel genetic loci related to tumor suppression and inflammation and immune response”. [Submitted]
Tian, Y, Kim A.E., et al (2021). “Genome-Wide Interaction Analysis of Common and Rare Genetic Variants with Menopausal Hormone Therapy for Colorectal Cancer Risk”. [Submitted]
Jordahl K.M., Shcherbina A., Kim A.E, et al (2021). “Beyond GWAS of colorectal cancer: Evidence of interaction with alcohol consumption and putative causal variant for the 10q24.2 region”. [Accepted]
Xia, Zhiyu, Yu-Ru Su, Paneen Petersen, Lihong Qi, Andre E. Kim, Jane C. Figueiredo, Yi Lin, et al. 2020. “Functional Informed Genome-Wide Interaction Analysis of Body Mass Index, Diabetes and Colorectal Cancer Risk.” Cancer Medicine 9 (10): 3563–73.

Stomach Cancer Disparity among Korean Americans by Tumor Characteristics: Comparison with Non-Hispanic Whites, Japanese Americans, South Koreans, and Japanese.
